note.p: Death: Paris, France (20 April 1750 or 20 April 1760)
Education: Began studying anatomy at the age of 12; MS (1700)

Career: Surgeon in the Army; Surgeon at the Hospital in Tournai (1697); practised in Paris, where he became the most famous surgeon in France; summoned to attend the King of Poland (1726) and the future King of Spain (1734); the King of Prussia sought his advice on training army surgeons; Royal Censor of surgical books; Director of the Academie Royale de Chirurgie (1731)
Proposers: Frank Nicholls: Sir Hans Sloane: William Rutty
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; printed list; Eloy; Hirsch
Notes: Hirsch gives date of death as 20 April 1760
